sentence.Network_en: A blizzard was blasting great drifts of snow across the lake.
sentence.Network_cn: 暴风雪夹着大团的积雪吹过湖面。

sentence.Network_en: He drew back the tent flap and strode out into the blizzard.
sentence.Network_cn: 他拉开帐篷的门帘，大步走进暴风雪中。

sentence.Network_en: Eleanor arrived in the midst of a blizzard.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃莉诺在暴风雪大作时到达。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (originally US, denoting a violent blow): of unknown origin

entry.def: A blizzard is a very bad snowstorm with strong winds.

entry.tran: （指令人反感或恼火的事情）大量，铺天盖地
entry.def: You can refer to a large number of things that you do not like or which annoy you as a blizzard of those things.

example.ex: Retailers were hit with a blizzard of new products and brands in all shapes, sizes and colours.
example.tran: 各种形色不一、大小各异的新产品和新品牌铺天盖地，让零售商们疲于应付。

example.ex: ...the annual blizzard of bills and amendments.
example.tran: 每年大量的议案和修正案

means.word_mean: 1. a storm with widespread snowfall accompanied by strong winds
2. a series of unexpected and unpleasant occurrences;

auth_sentence.content: A nocturnal blizzard had come on.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A nocturnal blizzard had come on.

auth_sentence.content: Ms. Zambello will direct "Annie Get Your Gun" and "The Blizzard at Marblehead Neck" herself.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ms. Zambello will direct "Annie Get Your Gun" and "The Blizzard at Marblehead Neck" herself.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ms. Zambello will direct "Annie Get Your Gun" and "The Blizzard at Marblehead Neck" herself.

sentences.en: We got stuck in a howling blizzard.
sentences.cn: 我们被困在怒号的暴风雪中。

sentences.en: The blizzard struck while we were still on the mountain.
sentences.cn: 我们还在山上的时候暴风雪就袭来了。

sentences.en: The blizzard forced them to delay their summit bid.
sentences.cn: 暴风雪迫使他们推迟登顶。

sentences.en: You’ll have to stay here until the blizzard blows itself off.
sentences.cn: 你得等暴风雪停了再走。

means.word_mean: 暴风雪似的一阵;大量(或大批)
